dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hooo-hoo! Oh man, this is juicy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hooo-hoo! Oh man, this is juicy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's like, you hear all these big promises, right? Everyone's a philanthropist, supposedly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's like, you hear all these big promises, right? Everyone's a philanthropist, supposedly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! But who actually opens their wallet, though? Like, who really does it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! But who actually opens their wallet, though? Like, who really does it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Forbes knows! They teamed up with Grantmakers Institute, uh, to track it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forbes knows! They teamed up with Grantmakers Institute, uh, to track it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To discover who made good on their philanthropic pledges, Forbes partnered with SHOOK Research of Boca Raton, Florida, and tracked which givers doled out the most funds in 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the key thing, for me, is they only counted money that, like, reached beneficiaries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the key thing, for me, is they only counted money that, like, reached beneficiaries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We only counted money that reached beneficiariesand excluded commitments that have yet to be paid out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes! Not just pledges, right? Or, uh, money sitting in a foundation not spent yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes! Not just pledges, right? Or, uh, money sitting in a foundation not spent yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also did not include donations that were made to charitable foundations, but which the foundations havent spent yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Only actual impact on underserved communities. That's, um, that's key.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Only actual impact on underserved communities. That's, um, that's key.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it turns out, no surprise, most of the top givers are also the richest. Like, all top ten are Forbes 400.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it turns out, no surprise, most of the top givers are also the richest. Like, all top ten are Forbes four hundred.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nine of the top ten givers made it to the ranks of the 2019 Forbes 400 list

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Warren Buffett, right? For the fifth year! Just, uh, keeps giving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Warren Buffett, right? For the fifth year! Just, uh, keeps giving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fifth year running, Berkshire Hathaway chairman Warren Buffett tops the list at No.1

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the Gates, obviously, with tropical disease stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the Gates, obviously, with tropical disease stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions Bill and Melinda Gates are in the top five, but does not specify what causes they donate to.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Bloomberg for urban renewal, um, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Bloomberg for urban renewal, um, which is huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions Michael Bloomberg is in the top five, but does not specify what causes he donates to.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And the Waltons for education! And George Soros for, like, global humanitarian causes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And the Waltons for education! And George Soros for, like, global humanitarian causes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions the Walton family and George Soros are in the top five, but does not specify what causes they donate to.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just incredible. America's 50 most generous, like, gave $14.15 billion in 2018 alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just incredible. America's fifty most generous, like, gave fourteen point one five dollars billion in twenty eighteen alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In total, America's 50 most generous philanthropists gave out $14.1 billion in 2018

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: In one year! And their lifetime giving? Over $180 billion, you know, combined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: In one year! And their lifetime giving? Over one hundred eighty dollars billion, you know, combined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Collectively, the group's lifetime givinga tally of funds distributed by their foundations plus direct giftsexceeds $173 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's just the actual money spent, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's just the actual money spent, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right! So, it's not just talk, it's, uh, the real deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! So, it's not just talk, it's, uh, the real deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the real deal. Itâ€™s kinda validating, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the real deal. It's kinda validating, you know?
